required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Knowledge , Attitude and Practice (KAP) of Fifth Year Undergraduate Dental Students on Post Exposure Prophylaxis
clinical_study.official_title: Knowledge , Attitude and Practice (KAP) of Fifth Year Undergraduate Dental Students on Post Exposure Prophylaxis: An Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: Considering the increasing number of HIV and HBV cases, the aim of this study is to evaluate the knowledge,Attitude and practice of fifth year undergraduate dental students regarding post-exposure prophylaxis.

detailed_description.textblock:
needle stick injury is inevitable. Needle stick injury is deﬁned as penetration of a sharp instrument into the body of a healthcare professional, exposing them to high-risk body ﬂuids.
Cutaneous injuries are the most common cause of infection transmission from patient to dentist. The causes of such injuries have been reported as 37% from dental burs , 30% from syringes , 6% from orthodonticwires , 3% from suture needles, 1% from blades and 2% from other sharp instruments .
Since high-risk exposure is unavoidable, dentists should be aware of post-exposure protocols to prevent infection .

primary_outcome.measure: Knowledge,Attitude and Practice questionnaire of fifth year undergraduate dental students on post exposure prophylaxis
primary_outcome.description: The questionnaire will be given to students to be filled in one of their clinical sections

intervention.description: KAP questionnaire for fifth year undergraduate dental students.

study_pop.textblock: Fifth year undergraduate dental students in Faculty of Dentistry , Cairo University

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All Fifth Year dental students in Faculty of Dentistry ,Cairo University at the time of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal of participation from the students.
